content: You are about to rename your portal. Are you sure you want to continue?

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a confirmation message before renaming a portal. It appears in a modal dialog that prompts the user to continue renaming their portal. The text should convey a sense of caution and ask for the user's surety.

usage.context:
<ModalDialog.Header>
 {t("Settings:PortalRenaming", { productName: t("Common:ProductName") })}
 </ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <Text fontSize="13px" fontWeight={400} noSelect>
 {t("Settings:PortalRenamingModalText")}
 </Text>
 </ModalDialog.Body>
 <ModalDialog.Footer>
 <Button
 key="PortalRenamingContinueBtn"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The possessive pronoun 'Váš' is overly formal and doesn't quite match the conversational tone of the English prompt. Using 'tvůj' would be more appropriate for a user-facing confirmation dialog.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Chystáte se přejmenovat tvůj portál. Jste si jistý, že chcete pokračovat?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Εισαι σιγουρος' is grammatically incorrect. It should be 'Είστε σίγουρος'. The use of 'Είσαι' is informal and used when addressing someone you know well. Since this is a portal setting, a formal address is more appropriate.
The phrase "apunto de" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "about to". It literally means "at the point of." A better translation would convey the immediacy of the action.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Usted está a punto de renombrar su portal. ¿Está seguro de que quiere continuar?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "¿Está seguro que quiere continuar?" is grammatically correct, a more common and natural phrasing in Spanish would be to use "¿Está seguro de que...?"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Usted está a punto de renombrar su portal. ¿Está seguro de que quiere continuar?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Olet nimeämässä uudelleen sivustoasi. Oletko varma?' is a literal translation and doesn't quite capture the natural flow of the English sentence. 'Sivustoasi' translates to 'your site', while 'portal' has a slightly different connotation and might be better expressed with a more contextually appropriate term.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Oletko aikeissa nimetä portaalisi uudelleen? Oletko varma?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrasing 'You are about to rename' carries a sense of immediacy that is not completely conveyed by 'Olet nimeämässä uudelleen'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The suggestion in the previous entry addresses this as well.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ポータル名を変更しようとしています 。操作を確認してください。' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "You are about to rename your portal. Are you sure you want to continue?".  '操作を確認してください' translates to 'Please confirm the operation' which is not the intended meaning. It is a confirmation of the *renaming* action, not just a confirmation of an operation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ポータル名を変更しようとしています。よろしいですか？ (Porāto-na o henkō shiyō to shite imasu. Yoroshii desu ka?)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "포털의 이름을 바꾸려고 합니다. 너 정말 계속하고 싶니?" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "You are about to rename your portal. Are you sure you want to continue?". The use of '너' (neo) is overly informal and inappropriate for a confirmation prompt within settings. '정말' also sounds slightly awkward in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 포털 이름을 변경하려고 합니다. 계속 진행하시겠습니까?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The question mark at the end feels slightly abrupt. A more polite phrasing would flow better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 포털 이름을 변경하려고 합니다. 계속 진행하시겠습니까?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "You are about to rename your portal" is not accurately reflected in the Lao translation "ທ່ານກຳລັງຈະປ່ຽນຊື່ປະຕູຂອງທ່ານ.".  'ປ່ຽນຊື່' primarily means 'to change the name' rather than 'to rename'. A more accurate translation would emphasize the action of renaming.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ທ່ານກຳລັງຈະນໍາໃຊ້ຊື່ໃໝ່ໃຫ້ປະຕູຂອງທ່ານ. (You are about to give a new name to your portal.) or ທ່ານກຳລັງຈະປ່ຽນຊື່ປະຕູຂອງທ່ານເປັນຊື່ໃໝ່ (You are about to change the name of your portal to a new name).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, the phrase "ທ່ານແນ່ໃຈບໍ່ວ່າຕ້ອງການສືບຕໍ່?" could be slightly more natural in Lao. It's a bit formal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ທ່ານຕ້ອງການສືບຕໍ່ບໍ່? (Do you want to continue?)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "U staat op het punt om uw portaal een andere naam te geven" is a bit verbose and doesn't quite capture the brevity of the English original. A more natural and concise translation would be closer to 'U gaat uw portaal hernoemen. Weet u het zeker?'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: U gaat uw portaal hernoemen. Weet u het zeker?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the phrasing 'Weet u zeker dat u wilt doorgaan?' is slightly less common/natural than 'Weet u het zeker?' in this context.

The translation 'ඔබගේ ද්වාරය නැවත නම් කිරීමට සැරසෙමින් සිටියි. ඉදිරියට යාමට වුවමනා ද?' doesn't perfectly capture the nuance of 'You are about to rename your portal. Are you sure you want to continue?'. The phrase 'සැරසෙමින් සිටියි' (saresemin siteyi) translates to 'is preparing to' which is less direct than 'You are about to'.

The translation is not idiomatic and doesn't accurately convey the intended meaning of the English phrase. 'Spremate se da preimenujete vaš portal' is a bit awkward. A more natural phrasing would be closer to 'Pripremaćete se da preimenujete...' or simply 'Preimenovaćete...'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Preimenovaćete vaš portal. Da li ste sigurni da želite da nastavite?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The verb 'spremaćete' seems to be a misspelling of 'pripremaćete'. While 'spremaćete' can mean 'to prepare', in the context of renaming, 'pripremaćete' is more appropriate as it implies readiness for the action.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pripremaćete se da preimenujete vaš portal. Da li ste sigurni da želite da nastavite?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '你将要重命名的门户' is not a natural way to describe renaming a portal. It's overly literal and a bit awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 你即将重命名你的门户。 (Nǐ jíjiāng chóngmíng nǐ de ménkǒu.) - This translates to 'You are about to rename your portal.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase '你真的要继续吗？' while technically correct, feels a little abrupt and less conversational compared to the English. It lacks a touch of politeness or confirmation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 你确定要继续吗？ (Nǐ quèdìng yào jìxù ma?) - This translates to 'Are you sure you want to continue?' and is a more common and natural phrasing.
